website_summaries.verdict: An affordable Ethernet switch with ample ports and a slim design as well as the possibility for some longevity issues.
pros: Features a trim design that works well in small work spaces
Can be mounted on a wall to save even more space
Easy to set up and use, and has 5 versatile ports
cons: Some reports of the unit failing to work after a fairly short period of use

customer_reviews.title: Dropped it and it still works, unlike TPLink
customer_reviews.text: It works in a dorm with Gigabit. I am only using 2 Pcs with gigabit but it's giving us both around 900mbps (ISPs fault). Im suprised for this price is works but it does feel very cheap. you get what you pay for, I dropped an expensiver tp link and it never worked again.
customer_reviews.author: Salami

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.  DOA and no support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this switch to replace a 5 port Ethernet switch I was borrowing from a friend and this switch did not work. Power light shows it has power, but the switch does not show any connections to my computers and it will not pass traffic. Emailed support a week ago, and received no response. Save yourself a lot of pain and buy a switch from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very small, fast, silent, and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Put this 5 port gigabit switch in my TV media cabinet to connect my google wifi router to my roku, media center PC and my son's xbox. It is very small and consumes almost no space at all in an already device crowded media cabinet shelf. Very happy with this small, stylish, gigabit switch.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Beautifully Simple
customer_reviews.text: No problems to speak of. Does its job, looks clean and minimal, and took all of 30 seconds to install. Everything this company touches is gold.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and fast.
customer_reviews.text: The best gigabit switch with this price. They are tiny and fit anywhere. Inexpensive and fast.
customer_reviews.author: HIDALGO SERRANO

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value with great build quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the best value switch you can get. I got this to split a cable coming to my upstairs and get the same signal across all my devices connected to the switch as I got with one Ethernet. Definitely recommended for serious tech users looking for a good value switch. (Be sure to plug cable from router into port 5 for best performance).
customer_reviews.author: Walter W

customer_reviews.title: works just as well as the more expensive models
customer_reviews.text: I moved into a retirement home and needed to network multiple devices in two rooms. I have an office where I have 2 computers, and a smart TV for which I use one, and a second room where I needed to network smart tv, Roku box, ATT set top box, Video player, and DVR recorder. I have a Gig network and these two boxes work just as well as the more expensive boxes. The power cord/adapter could have a longer cable as my power source was located feet away from where I needed to plug in, so I purchased a low capacity extension cord to compensate.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Nolting

customer_reviews.title: Working great for my application
customer_reviews.text: Working great for my application. I needed a small giga-switch to daisy-chain a LAN cable from my networked stereo (Marantz NR1200) across the room to my PC. It is small and light and I stuck it to a bookshelf wall with Scotch Removable Wall Mounts plus one small screw for the pair of keyhole mounts. (Do those keyhole mounts ever really line up?) It uses a small wall wart and those are often a pain to fit onto a power strip without covering up another outlet but fortunately I had a outlet to sacrifice on mine. I measured throughput to my LAN with and without this switch and saw no degradation but the IP is only (Only?) 200 mbps.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Smokin Junk !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ethernet splitter for my home office. It worked great for a while with high speeds as expected. After 3 weeks however, the product died and began smoking and was really hot. I immidiately unplugged it and was very unpleaded in the life span of this product. It is lightweight and cheap but only because it is not a quality item. Do yourself a favor and buy an American Made product that is reliable and will always get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Christina D Billingsley

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper not better
customer_reviews.text: Used this to improve download speed from wireless modem however once I hired a network expert to complete our structured wiring install from from 15 years ago. This switch claims to have Gigabit pass through but when tested only allowed 100 Mbps pass through from modem. Waited too long to hire expect now not able to return. Oops
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight, fast little switch
customer_reviews.text: I work in the medical automation field, and travel for work. I sometimes need to get several machines online with access to only a single port. This little guy works perfectly for me. I have enough weight in my backpack for travel, and it doesn't get much lighter than this guy. It also has plenty of bandwidth for my applications and has a dedicated power plug. It's held up to several installs and numerous flights. A nice addition if you are a field tech or travel networker
customer_reviews.author: A2theJackson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I needed to expand my ethernet capabilities. You are able to hook your modem up to Port 1 and use 2 to 5 to hook up whatever you need to get internet. I use a Tenda mesh network at home and it has been super to what I have used in the past! No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the more expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: I have a total of four switches in my network. What an amazing way to get the most out of your Cat 5,6,7 or whatever. My kitchen PC speed checks at 25 to 30 over the wireless and jumps to 500 to 600 when plugged in. I have one cable to the room and the switch allows me to connect my TV, PC and ADT base. Talk about bang for the buck... this is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: LMH

customer_reviews.title: Value for your money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small gigethernet switch, so far it is working smoothly and I have plugged 2 devices and it's plugged to a powerline adapter and it's working just great. At this price the plastic case is understandable, it can be screwed to a wall or behind a desk, it's so light weight that I would say that even a good double sided tape would do it.
customer_reviews.author: JrCm

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly excellent for being so inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: I have both a laptop and a desktop pc I like directly hard-wired to my Google router, in order to reach 700 t0 900 mbps possible for downloading and uploading. Since my Google router only has one Ethernet output, I ordered this Tenda 5-Port Gigabit Ethernet Desktop Switch for less than $15 and though it is smaller than expected, it works perfect for multiple (up to 4!) Ethernet connections.
customer_reviews.author: rpl1

customer_reviews.title: Plug internet into plug 5, devices in plug 1-4
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent. Allows 4 devices to connect to the internet at the same time using ethernet cables. Just plug your internet cable into the slot marked 5, then plug your devices into the other 4 ethernet ports for even distribution of internet and LAN connections. If your just doing offline LAN this will work great for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Power plug is on the side and looks ugly
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good it's a nice small unit, but power input is on the side and really kills the ability to hide the wires and make it look nice on a desktop. If style is not a concern it's a great little unit, but I bought it to look good in the entertainment center so very disappointed in form factor.
customer_reviews.author: StophinHousen

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: easy install and does exactly what i needed. Purchased this to extend my wireless router to my bedroom for my tv and security camera. The hardest part was running the cable in the attic but after that, it was an easy install and works great. Especially for the price. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: cd

customer_reviews.title: Nice small 5 Port switch. Great for home LAN.
customer_reviews.text: Works really good. Smaller and lighter than I thought it would be, but it fills out my home gigabit Ethernet LAN quite well, and at a budget price. I would buy this item again if I need to add another switch to my network. If a small 5 Port switch is what you're looking for this is a good one to get for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel McRae

customer_reviews.title: Issues less than a month after using.
customer_reviews.text: Not even a month into using it and already there are LAN issues when I have my ps4 hooked up. I know it's not the cable itself or my ps4 because I never have that issue when I connect my ps4 directly to the wall. Would suggest you look elsewhere if you want something that'll last you a lot longer. Just a heads up, I have my laptop and ps4 hooked up to this box. I have it setup that way so I can stream netflix or something when I'm not too busy on my laptop for work.
customer_reviews.author: Yery

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in and forget about it
customer_reviews.text: I have a few devices that I want connected to my network via Ethernet cord (a couple of printers, a scanner, an Android TV box), but doing so would max out my router's open ports. I was able to connect everything to this switch, tying up only 1 port on my router. The connections are solid, and setup only took a matter of seconds.
customer_reviews.author: RGroves

customer_reviews.title: Nice price and function
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed by the tiny size, weight and packaging. I bought 6 units for my lab, they all worked perfect, have mounting screw slots on back side and all ports have activity light as well as a power light. Chassis is black plastic. Good length on the included ac adapter. Good support instructions with a phone number.
customer_reviews.author: E-Today

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Powers on, but never detects anything is plugged into any port.
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: Fits in the palm of your hand. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 switches and was surprised at how small these units are compared to the budget 5 port I have from netgear. I fit both switches behind my ethernet connected tv's and i am getting full bandwidth. For the money, the tenda 5 port switch is a great buy. Good bye over priced name brand switches, I am purchasing 2 more tenda switches to complete my home setup.
customer_reviews.author: butcho

customer_reviews.title: What! It Just Works, Period
customer_reviews.text: What! It Just Works, Period. Plugged it in with the adapter included and 4 other RJ45 cat 7 cables and they all work flawlessly. NOICE!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gravatt

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, fast and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This Tenda switch does what it is supposed to: Add network ports, network speeds are high, takes little space and just works. Nothing more to add. Great product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pace Ripley

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in my entertainment to run ethernet to my smart tv, DISH receiver & Amazon FireTV. PnP set up and up and running in minutes. Very pleased and the price is a deal.
customer_reviews.author: pizmobob

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great haven't hooked up to my gig Speed Internet. Have a 100' cable hooked up to The switch and another 50' cable and still giving solid one gig
customer_reviews.author: Tim Contraros

customer_reviews.title: Flawless operation
customer_reviews.text: Stil working flawlessly after months of use, great , but i did not have to use tech support so no idea how to rate them. Which is a good thing the flawlessy working working product did not needs there assitance
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D Warren

customer_reviews.title: Does not work very well for me
customer_reviews.text: Is not compatible with at and t uverse had to get a netgear
customer_reviews.author: Walpole

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Died in 35 days, just after the Amazon return window. Power light comes on but none of the ports are active and the port lights are all off.
customer_reviews.author: Sachin

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive gem really fit the bill. It's small, plug and play, and just works. I needed a few ports at my workstation to connect my laptop and two desktops and it works flawlessly. recommended!
customer_reviews.author: R. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and effective
customer_reviews.text: Simple and straightforward to use and looks way better than the collection of cables and connections that were showing before this solution.
customer_reviews.author: DeltaQuest

customer_reviews.title: works great 1GB throughput
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive and great connectivity. we use it for connecting multiple stream devices (roku, xbox, amazon sticks)
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wall

customer_reviews.title: Gig speed that doesn’t break the bank
customer_reviews.text: Needed a small switch for a few networked printers. Thi switch has been great. Printing is fast & we haven’t had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Almeida

customer_reviews.title: it's a switch, working as expected
customer_reviews.text: it's a switch, working as expected. have not needed tech support or wifi. Not sure this switch has wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Zambo

customer_reviews.title: tee-niny but works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to connect PC, printer and DISH Joey to LAN in home. This bit of connectivity worked like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: R. Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Really not much to say, plug it in and add network lines. Nothing too exciting, it works, good price, not much else.
customer_reviews.author: Michael James Rozlog

customer_reviews.title: Worth a look.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent router for the money seems to transfer files quickly, with out any issues.
customer_reviews.author: KirtW

customer_reviews.title: Network extender
customer_reviews.text: The item installed easily on my network and gave me additional ports for network drives. Good item.
customer_reviews.author: Mr David Mayne

customer_reviews.title: Just...
customer_reviews.text: What we needed and it does exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: CGriffin

customer_reviews.title: Works great what a good price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got it in hrs after order!!!! Soooo fast good job Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: CHUCk HUDNELL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: perfect you will get true 1000m connection and it works perfect. Just connect and it work's.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Works, but it ain't very stable.
customer_reviews.text: My Super Mario 64 cartridge is lighter than this thing. Plug in any cord that has a mind of it's own and this box will not sit flat. But it works like it's supposed to, and I suppose you can drill it into the wall. Comes decently packaged, too.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas B. Feezel

customer_reviews.title: Half the price of others, worked great
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on plastic construction vs normal metal construction. Working out perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Young

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for my buck
customer_reviews.text: This little device is a life saver! Went to Walmart and target and both only carried a $40 Ethernet switch that was out of stock and then checked amazon and seen this bad boi! Got 2 for the price of one! Got it the next day with my prime, hooked both of them up to my ps4, Xbox one, tv, 2 pc’s and a laptop Live streaming gameplay on twitch and operating with no problems! I love it
customer_reviews.author: SioneAudra

customer_reviews.title: Because Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: Don't have to pay Spectrum money every month just to be allowed to use all the ports on the back of my modem any more. Super simple set-up and now I can hard-line to all my devices.
customer_reviews.author: lombax

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play switch.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to split a gigabit internet connection between my computer tower and a couple of servers. Works perfectly and without a single issue.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good little switch
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I initially thought it was a bad switch but after further investigation it turned out to be a pc on my network causing issues
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable; Doesn’t tell you if its running gig speed, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Liked the small size. Gave it a try. Opened up the box, powered it up, plugged in Ethernet, power light and Ethernet lights on and It worked fine. Powered it down, moved it, powered it up, just the power light came on, no Ethernet lights. If you’re looking for a switch that tells if its running gig speed, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from RI

customer_reviews.title: It works just fine!
customer_reviews.text: Got this little box. Does the job. Simple hook up. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little switch !!
customer_reviews.text: Such a small little switch. hides in the corner and does what is supposed, and that deliver 1GB network to a few computers close to each other.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent plug and play setup
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional delivery speed and pricing is perfect Excellent product set up and compact design Highly recommend to extend your router and number of ports

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Was an awesome product well-packaged, works great and an excellent value for the money very simple easy setup plug and play love it very nice thank you

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for..
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about 2 weeks then dead. When I removed it from the setup everything else works again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly. One year and no problems!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I bought this Tenda switch last October (2017). I use it with 4 ethernet devices 24/7 and it receives heavy use most of the day. No issues to report!
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to split one ethernet line for 2 computers. Easy set up works great get the same speed from both of the devices. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have to unplug it about every time I switch connected devices. Not worth the money, in my opinion.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install-works great for my work from home ethernet phone

customer_reviews.title: This is a solid product with throughput as described
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how to amend/correct my previous comment about this product. I am sorry to say that I was wrong. My earlier problem was with the cable itself. After resetting everything, I was able to get the correct throughput as described. My apology to the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Min L.

customer_reviews.title: Works just as good the those that cost twice as much!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement of a high end device and it works better for a fraction of the cost!

customer_reviews.title: Fast tech support worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I called tech support and got manich he answered right away and was very helpful it is a plug-and-play I plugged it in the wrong side and it was up and running in two minutes thank you for your quick support The router works as expected worth the money

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing
customer_reviews.text: this has helped keep things going without any problems. Thank you.

customer_reviews.title: great for multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: The plastic feels kinda cheap but it works as advertised. I ran an ethernet cable to my room and use this to connect all my devices through ethernet as well (PC, ps4, tv)

customer_reviews.title: Small , compact and connection easy!!
customer_reviews.text: Price, small and easily setup. Did exactly as it was suppose to.

customer_reviews.title: I expected it to be a bit better quality, and not as "loosely" put together as ...

I expected it to be a bit better quality, and not as "loosely" put together as this. the lights weakly display the signal and connection. my biggest issue is the dropped connections. it can't seem to reliably handle me and my apartment mate's usage, so we decided to just go back to using wifi.

customer_reviews.text: I ordered this over the weekend because our apartment uses a lot of bandwidth. We weren't looking for insane speeds, but the speed for sure was not reliable at all. It would drop frequently and it was basically the same as just connecting to wifi. It's only been 2 days but I'm going to return it.

product_meta.title: Tenda 5 Port Gigabit Ethernet Network Switch | Ethernet Splitter | Plug-and-Play | Traffic Optimization | Unmanaged (SG105), Black
product_meta.description: Style:5 Port| Color:Gigabit SpeedSG105 is a Gigabit Ethernet switch, of high performance and easy maintenance. it also provides 5 10/100/1000Mbps Auto-Negotiation ports, and supports automatic MDI/MDI these Gigabit ports can not only be used as ordinary ports, but can also cascade to other network devices through uplink port. in full duplex mode, SG105 can be used to replace the 10/100 Mbps switch, to solve the bottleneck problem of the server terminal connection.
feature_bullets: PLUG-AND-PLAY - Easy setup with no configuration or software required
NICE & SMALL The SG105 is 4 in x 2. 5 in, taking up minimal space while delivering maximum efficiency
ETHERNET SPLITTER - Provides quick and easy connectivity to your router and/or modem, offering additional wired connections for your laptop, gaming console, printer, etc…
5 PORT GIGABIT ETHERNET - Features Five 10/100/1000 Mbps auto-negotiating RJ45 Gigabit ports to greatly expand your network capacity and supports Auto MDI/MDIX
AUTO-NEGOTIATION - Supports Auto-MDI/MDIX, eliminating the need for crossover cables
LIFETIME FREE TECH-SUPPORT: Tenda provides an industry-leading 3-year , with FREE lifetime 24/7 dedicated tech-support team. Call us at (800) 570-5892 or email us at Support. usa@tenda. cn

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars747 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
